main event: A bright metallic circular object was observed in Warren, Michigan on 17 August 1958.
interesting points: The object was first seen as the size of a pin and later appeared as a large circular gray-white object through field glasses,The object was inactive for approximately seven to eight minutes before becoming active,The sighting lasted about 6 to 10 minutes,The object then slowly moved WSW and disappeared,It was described as brighter than Venus or other stars.
witness description: Mr. Cunningham, a civilian working in business machine repair and sales
